articles.title: Pelosi says House to vote on resolution to limit Trump's military actions on Iran
articles.description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said the House will introduce and vote on a war powers resolution this week to limit U.S. President Donald Trump's military actions regarding Iran.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said the House will introduce and vote on a war powers resolution this week to limit U.S. President Donald Trump’s military actions regarding Iran.

articles.author: Hyunjoo Jin
articles.title: Samsung to draw line under lacklustre 2019 with chip revival in store
articles.description: With Samsung Electronics expected to suffer its biggest annual profit drop in at least a decade, investors are counting on an expected uptick in the memory-chip market to cure the tech giant's ills this year.
articles.content:
SEOUL (Reuters) - With Samsung Electronics expected to suffer its biggest annual profit drop in at least a decade, investors are counting on an expected uptick in the memory-chip market to cure the tech giant’s ills this year.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Equinor eyes 40% greenhouse gas cuts in Norway by 2030
articles.description: Oil major Equinor aims to cut greenhouse gas emissions generated at its offshore fields and onshore plants in its native Norway by about 40% in the coming decade, the company said in a statement on Monday.
articles.content:
OSLO (Reuters) - Oil major Equinor aims to cut greenhouse gas emissions generated at its offshore fields and onshore plants in its native Norway by about 40% in the coming decade, the company said in a statement on Monday. 
Equinor and its partners plan to i… [+307 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Slain Iranian commander's daughter says U.S. faces 'dark day'
articles.description: The daughter of the slain commander of Iran's Quds Force told a huge crowd on Monday at his funeral ceremony in Tehran that the United States and its ally Israel faced a "dark day" for his death.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - The daughter of the slain commander of Iran’s Quds Force told a huge crowd on Monday at his funeral ceremony in Tehran that the United States and its ally Israel faced a “dark day” for his death.

articles.author: Swati Pandey
articles.title: Australian bushfires hit businesses, damage still being assessed
articles.description: As Australia's deadly bushfires rage, many companies are reporting hits to business with resorts shutting their doors, cheesemakers struggling to secure milk supplies and insurance claims on the rise.
articles.content:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - As Australia’s deadly bushfires rage, many companies are reporting hits to business with resorts shutting their doors, cheesemakers struggling to secure milk supplies and insurance claims on the rise. 
As many as 5,850 fire-related insuran… [+2684 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Buoyant demand boosts India services activity to five-month high in December
articles.description: Activity in India's dominant service industry accelerated to a five-month high in December as demand rose at the fastest pace in more than three years, a private business survey showed on Monday.
articles.content:
BENGALURU (Reuters) - Activity in India’s dominant service industry accelerated to a five-month high in December as demand rose at the fastest pace in more than three years, a private business survey showed on Monday. 
The findings are likely to provide some… [+2164 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Pennsylvania pile-up kills five, injures 60
articles.description: Three big trucks plowed into a tour bus that swerved into an embankment, closing a major highway across the state. Olivia Chan reports.
articles.content:
Posted 
Three big trucks plowed into a tour bus that swerved into an embankment, closing a major highway across the state. Olivia Chan reports.

articles.title: Ricky Gervais skewers Hollywood's A-list as Golden Globes host

articles.title: Gold jumps to near 7-year high on U.S.-Iran tensions; palladium breaches $2,000
articles.description: Gold surged close to a seven-year peak on Monday, as investors flocked to the safe-haven metal on escalating U.S.-Iran tensions, while palladium surpassed the level of $2,000 to hit a record high.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Gold surged close to a seven-year peak on Monday, as investors flocked to the safe-haven metal on escalating U.S.-Iran tensions, while palladium surpassed the level of $2,000 to hit a record high. 
Spot gold rose 1.7% to stand at $1,577.98 per ou… [+2069 chars]

articles.title: U.S. EPA to advance plan to cut heavy-duty truck emissions

articles.title: Japan in principle could press Lebanon to extradite ex-Nissan boss Ghosn - Japan minister
articles.description: Japan on Monday said it could still press Lebanon to extradite Carlos Ghosn, after the former Nissan Motor boss skipped bail to become a fugitive in a country that normally does not extradite its nationals.

TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan on Monday said it could still press Lebanon to extradite Carlos Ghosn, after the former Nissan Motor boss skipped bail to become a fugitive in a country that normally does not extradite its nationals.
